data.title: For Finals
data.meta_description: Gizmo uses AI to make learning easy. Gizmo's AI turns any learning material into flashcards and then quizzes you on them in a gamified way using spaced repetition and active recall. Start learning these flashcards about for finals
data.text:
Respiratory care

Promotion of optimal cardiopulmonary function and health

Respiratory care practitioners

Respiratory therapists

Stokes & Hoppe-Seyler demonstrate the oxygen transport function of hemoglobin

1860

Gustav Killian - first bronchoscopy in Germany

1897

Thomas Willis defines specific Asthma symptoms for diagnosis

1899

Phillip Drinker develops the 'iron lung' negative pressure ventilator

1928

Dr. Erwin R. Levine, MD train technicians in basic inhalation therapy for post-surgical patients

1943

The AAIT publish a science journal, Inhalation Therapy (Respiratory Care)

1956

Sister Mary Yvonne Jenn, first Registered Therapist

1961

Mechanical Ventilation

Mouth-to-mouth resuscitation 1744, positive pressure ventilation using bag-mask or bellows, negative pressure ventilation (iron lung 1928, chest cuirass, negative pressure "wrap" ventilator), PEEP 1967, IMV 1971, SIMV 1975, mandatory minute volume 1977, pressure support ventilation 1980s, pressure-regulated volume control 1990s

Airway Management

Tracheostomies to relieve airway obstruction since 1500 BC, laryngeal intubation 160 AD, endotracheal intubation 1880, laryngoscope 1913, nasotracheal suctioning 1938, Murphy suction catheter 1941, double-lumen tubes 1940, low-pressure cuffs 1970s
